searchstatus.label: Status
searchstatus.comment: Set this to "Disabled" to use the default Magento search. Set this to "Enabled" when you wish to make Nextopia Search live. You can perform test searches by appending "++" to your search term e.g. "shoes++".

private_client_id.label: Private Client ID
private_client_id.comment: This can be obtained by visisting the Account section of the Nextopia control panel. It will look something like "1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef" and is 32 characters long. Leave blank to enter demo mode live on your site. While in demo mode, appending "++" to your search term e.g. "shoes++" will display results that use the demo data.

public_client_id.label: Public Client ID
public_client_id.comment: This can be obtained by visisting the Account section of the Nextopia control panel. It will look something like "1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef" and is 32 characters long. Leave blank to enter demo mode live on your site. While in demo mode, appending "++" to your search term e.g. "shoes++" will display results that use the demo data.

redirect_on_one_match.label: Redirect on one match
redirect_on_one_match.comment: This controls if the system should send the user to the product if there is only one match.

load_method.label: Load products using
load_method.comment: This controls if the products are loaded by product id or Sku.

productid_field_name.label: Product ID field name
productid_field_name.comment: The name of the Product ID field in your Nextopia data.

refine_mappings.label: Visible Refine Names
refine_mappings.comment:
Enter in the mappings one per line with a comma.
Format: Label,Display Label

refine_order.label: Refinement Order
refine_order.comment: Enter in a comma separated list of refinement names in the order in which you would like them to appear.

refines_sorted_numerically.label: Refinements Sorted Numerically
refines_sorted_numerically.comment: Enter a comma separated list of refinement names which you would like to have sorted based on number of products.
